Label: Innovation Name
Definition: Primary name for the innovation as reported by the source used in the horizon scan.

Label: Alternative Names
Definition: Other names used for the same innovation (generic name, brand names, synonyms, registry names, database aliases).

Label: Innovation Category
Definition: High-level category of the innovation, used to drive downstream fields like technology and readiness requirements.

Label: Technology
Definition: Technology classification within the innovation category (more specific than category). Should be a controlled vocabulary to support filtering and comparison.
Choices/Unit: Diagnostics: RDT, molecular (PCR/NAAT), antigen, antibody/serology, culture, imaging, biosensor, multiplex panel, AI/algorithmic. Therapeutics: small molecule, biologic/monoclonal, gene therapy, cell therapy, drug-device combination, long-acting formulation, repurposed drug. Vaccines: mRNA, viral vector, protein subunit, conjugate, live attenuated, inactivated, DNA, nanoparticle. Devices: implantable, wearable, point-of-care device, digital health, decision support, specimen collection, cold-chain/logistics.

Label: Disease
Definition: Disease domain targeted by the innovation (primary classification for the scan).

Label: Indication
Definition: Specific clinical indication and use-case (what condition, stage, population, setting, and intent). Example: “uncomplicated falciparum malaria treatment”, “TB preventive therapy”, “PPH prevention”, “pediatric HIV viral load monitoring”.
Choices/Unit: Free text: condition + intent + population + setting

Label: Archetype
Definition: Maturity archetype aligned to Young et al definitions, used as a simplified development stage label.

Label: Country
Definition: Country marker for where the data comes from

Label: Clinical Trial Status
Definition: Most advanced known clinical development status (or best available evidence stage) at the time of extraction.
Choices/Unit: Preclinical; Phase 1; Phase 2; Phase 3; Phase 4; Observational; Implementation/Pilot; Not in trials; Unknown

Label: Date Trial Status
Definition: Date the trial status was last verified or updated (from registry update date, publication date, or extraction date).

Label: National Regulatory Approval (NRA)
Definition: Whether the innovation has approval/authorization by a national regulatory authority relevant to the setting being evaluated.

Label: NRA Date
Definition: Date of NRA approval/authorization (if known).

Label: NRA Body
Definition: Name of the national regulatory authority granting approval (for example: SAHPRA, PPB, DPM/Ministry authority).
Choices/Unit: Recommended to store as controlled list per country; allow “Other”

Label: NRA Note
Definition: Free-text notes supporting NRA fields (scope, conditions of approval, evidence, link/reference, ambiguity).

Label: Global Regulatory Approval (GRA)
Definition: Whether the innovation has approval/authorization/prequalification by a global body.

Label: GRA Date
Definition: Date of global approval/prequalification (if known).

Label: GRA Body
Definition: Global body granting approval or listing (for example: WHO PQ, FDA, EMA, Global Fund listing where applicable).

Label: GRA Note
Definition: Notes supporting GRA fields (type of approval, scope, link/reference, ambiguity).

Label: In Essential Medicine List
Definition: Whether the innovation is listed on a country Essential Medicines List (or equivalent national formulary list).

Label: EML Date
Definition: Date of EML publication or date the innovation was included (if available).

Label: EML Country
Definition: Country whose EML was assessed for inclusion.

Label: EML Note
Definition: Notes about EML matching (exact name vs synonym, formulation, dosage form, section, uncertainty).

Label: Probability of Success
Definition: Model-based probability of success (for example Gates PoS) reflecting likelihood of reaching intended impact, typically conditional on stage.

Label: Procurement Model
Definition: Likely procurement mechanism in-country (how it would be bought and by whom).
Choices/Unit: Government tender; Donor-funded; Pooled procurement; Private sector; Mixed; Unknown

Label: Regulatory Approval
Definition: Summary regulatory readiness derived from EML, NRA, and GRA status (a synthesized field for scoring).
Choices/Unit: None; NRA only; GRA only; NRA+GRA; EML listed; Unknown

Label: Policy Readiness
Definition: Degree to which policies and strategies support adoption (national strategies, reimbursement, prioritization).

Label: Social Context
Definition: Contextual fit, acceptability, equity implications, and likely adoption barriers related to the innovation and setting.
Choices/Unit: Low barrier; Moderate barrier; High barrier; Unknown

Label: Guidelines and Training
Definition: Availability and maturity of clinical guidelines, training materials, and competency pathways needed for delivery.
Choices/Unit: Not available; In development; Available (limited); Available (widely); Unknown

Label: Policy Implemented
Definition: Whether relevant policies are actively implemented (not just written), including programmatic coverage.

Label: Date to Reach Market
Definition: Expected date of market entry or availability for procurement in the target setting.

Label: In Country Supply
Definition: Whether there is local manufacturing, packaging, assembly, or reliable in-country supply channels.

Label: Distribution
Definition: Expected distribution channel and constraints (cold chain, last-mile, facility level, community delivery).
Choices/Unit: Central medical stores; Facility-based; Community-based; Private pharmacies; Hybrid; Unknown

Label: Delivery Model
Definition: How the innovation is delivered clinically or programmatically (who delivers it, where, and workflow).
Choices/Unit: Facility outpatient; Inpatient; Community health worker; Outreach campaigns; Self-administered; Digital/remote; Hybrid

Label: Efficacy
Definition: Best available efficacy/effectiveness estimate (and context), ideally quantitative but can be summarized when early-stage.
Ranges: If numeric: 0 to 1 (or 0 to 100 if percent)

Label: Disability-Adjusted Life Years (DALYs)
Definition: Baseline DALYs for the disease and geography relevant to the scan (usually disease burden input, not innovation-specific).

Label: Disease Prevalence
Definition: Baseline prevalence (or incidence if more appropriate) for the disease and target setting, aligned to the analysis approach.

Label: Improvement
Definition: Mechanism of benefit relative to standard of care (what improves and how). Example: higher sensitivity, fewer stockouts, shorter time-to-treatment, reduced adverse events.
Choices/Unit: Free text; optionally map to controlled terms later

Label: DALYs Averted
Definition: Estimated DALYs averted attributable to adoption of the innovation under stated assumptions.

Label: Deaths Averted
Definition: Estimated deaths averted attributable to adoption of the innovation under stated assumptions.

Label: Years of Life Lost (YLL)
Definition: Estimated years of life lost averted due to the innovation (subset of DALYs or separate component depending on approach).

Label: Health Systems Costs
Definition: R&D estimates according to Terry RF, Gardner CA, Dieleman JL, et al. *Funding global health product R&D: the Portfolio-to-Impact (P2I) model.* Health Policy Plan. 2018.

Label: Monetized DALYs
Definition: Monetized value of DALYs averted using stated conversion (for example value per DALY or VSLY approach).

Label: Time to Regulatory Approval
Definition: Estimated time from proof of concept to first regulatory approval, based on stage-specific spedometer assumptions.

Label: Time from Approval to First Launch
Definition: Estimated time between regulatory approval and first country launch.

Label: Time from Launch to 20% LMIC Uptake
Definition: Estimated time from first country launch to achieving 20% uptake in at least one LMIC.

Label: Expected Regulatory Approval Date
Definition: Expected date of first regulatory approval, calculated from trial completion date and estimated development time.

Label: Expected First Launch Date
Definition: Expected date of first country-level launch, calculated from expected regulatory approval date.

Label: Expected 20% Market Uptake Date
Definition: Expected date when the innovation reaches 20% uptake in an LMIC.

Label: Overall Readiness Score
Definition: Composite readiness score summarizing regulatory, policy, financing, and delivery preparedness.

Label: Financing Readiness
Definition: Financing readiness score derived from probability of success and procurement model availability.
